thing-type.label: ZW096 Smart Switch 6
thing-type.description: Smart Switch 6<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtAeon Labs Smart Switch is a Z-Wave power binary switch device based on Z-Wave enhanced 232 slave library V6.51.06.</p&gt <p&gtIts surface has the Smart RGB LEDs on, which can be used for indicating the output load status, the strength of wireless signal. You can also configure its indication colour according to your favour.</p&gt <p&gtIt can be included and operated in any Z-wave network with other Z-wave certified devices from other manufacturers and/or other applications. All non-battery operated nodes within the network will act as repeaters regardless of vendor to increase reliability of the network.</p&gt <p&gtIt is also a security Z-wave device and supports the Over The Air (OTA) feature for the product’s firmware upgrade.<br /&gtAs soon as Smart Switch is removed from a z-wave network it will be restored into default factory setting.</p&gt <p&gtReset Smart Switch to factory Default:</p&gt <ol&gt<li&gtMake sure the Smart Switch has been connected to the power supply.</li&gt <li&gtPress and hold the Z-wave button for 20 seconds.</li&gt <li&gtIf holding time more than one second, the LED will blink faster and faster. If holding time more than 20seconds, the green LED will be on for 2 seconds and then remain colorful gradient status, it indicates reset success, otherwise please repeat step 2.</li&gt </ol&gt<p&gtNote:</p&gt <ol&gt<li&gtThis procedure should only be used when the primary controller is inoperable.</li&gt <li&gtReset Smart Switch to factory default settings will: sets the Smart Switch to not in Z-Wave network state; delete the Association setting, power measure value, Scene Configuration Settings and restore the Configuration setting to the default</li&gt </ol&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtInclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtAdd Smart Switch into a z-wave network:</p&gt <ol&gt<li&gtInsert the Smart Switch to power socket, The purple LED will be colorful gradient status.</li&gt <li&gtLet the primary controller into inclusion mode (If you don’t know how to do this, refer to its manual).</li&gt <li&gtPress the Action button.</li&gt <li&gtIf the inclusion success, Smart Switch LED will be solid. Otherwise, the LED will remain colorful gradient status, in which you need to repeat the process from step 2.</li&gt </ol&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtExclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtRemove Smart Switch from a z-wave network:</p&gt <ol&gt<li&gtInsert the Smart Switch to power socket, The Smart Switch LED will be solid.</li&gt <li&gtLet the primary controller into remove mode (If you don’t know how to do this, refer to its manual).</li&gt <li&gtPress the Action button.</li&gt <li&gtIf the remove is successful, Smart Switch LED will blink slowly. If Smart Switch LED still be solid, please repeat the process from step 2.</li&gt </ol&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtWakeup Information</h2&gt<p&gtmains device</p&gt

parameter.name: config_3_1
parameter.label: 3: Current overload protection enable
parameter.description: Current overload protection enable<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtCurrent Overload Protection. Load will be closed when the Current overrun (US: 15.5A, other country: 16.2A) and the time more than 2 minutes (0=disabled, 1=enabled).</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_20_1
parameter.label: 20: Output load after re-power
parameter.description: Configure the output load status after re‐power<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtConfigure the output load status after re-power on<br /&gt(0=last status, 1=always on, 2=always off)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_33_4_wo
parameter.label: 33: RGB LED color testing
parameter.description: Set the RGB LED color value for testing.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtValue1: Reserved</p&gt <p&gtValue2: Red value</p&gt <p&gtValue3: Green value</p&gt <p&gtValue4: Blue value</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_80_1
parameter.label: 80: Enable send to associated devices
parameter.description: Enable to send notifications to Group 1<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtEnable to send notifications to associated devices (Group 1) when the state of Micro Switch’s load changed (0=nothing, 1=hail CC, 2=basic CC report).</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_81_1
parameter.label: 81: Configure LED state
parameter.description: Configure the state of the LED<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtConfigure the state of LED when it is in 3 modes below:</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gt0= The LED will follow the status (on/off) of its load (Energy mode).</li&gt <li&gt1= When the state of Switch’s load changed, The LED will follow the status (on/off) of its load, but the red LED will turn off after 5 seconds if there is no any switch action (momentary indicate mode).</li&gt <li&gt2= Night light mode.</li&gt </ul&gt</p&gt
